intro: Zosterostylis walkerae, commonly known as the narrowleaf zosterostylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in heathlands and dry forests, preferring well-drained soils. Zosterostylis walkerae is often found in coastal and inland regions of southern Australia.
